'''Hugo Wilhelm Freiherr von Abercron''' (24 October 1869 – 16 April 1945) was a German officer, [[major general]], balloonist and [[non-fiction]] author. He was one of the most important German balloonists in the inter-war years.
==Life== Abercron was born in Bosatz, Silesia near [[Racibórz|Ratibor]] (modern Raciborz), the son of the [[Prussia]]n officer Christian Abercron and his wife, Maria Theresa, née Hinsch.
After he graduated from high school, on March 22, 1888, he entered the [[Prussian army]] as a [[Leutnant]]. On September 12, 1895, he was promoted to [[Oberleutnant]]. In 1903 and 1910 he served as a [[captain (armed forces)|captain]] and [[company commander]] in [[Düsseldorf]].
From 1906 to 1927 he was the chairman of the free balloon department in the Deutschen Luftfahrtverbandes (DLV) (later ''Deutscher Luftfahrtverein''). He took part in the [[Gordon Bennett Cup (ballooning)|Gordon Bennett Cup]] several times, reaching third place at [[St. Louis]] in 1910.
At the outbreak of [[World War I]], Abercron was appointed commander of the newly founded Reserve-Infanterie-Regiment, which he commanded at the [[Western Front (World War I)|Western Front]] as well as in the [[Battle of Verdun]].
After the war he worked for the reconstruction of German aviation. In 1932 he became the manager of Institut für volkstümliche Naturkunde URANIA, in [[Berlin]].<ref>http://static.urania.de/static-img/jubilaeum-2013/Urania-Begleitheft.pdf</ref>
He wrote an autobiography called ''Hugo von Abercron. Offizier und Luftpionier''.
==Awards== * [[Order of the Red Eagle]] * [[Order of Saint John (Bailiwick of Brandenburg)]] * Prussian Service Cross * [[Order of Henry the Lion]] * [[House and Merit Order of Peter Frederick Louis]] * [[Order of the White Falcon]] * [[Saxe-Ernestine House Order]] * [[Friedrich Order]]
